titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Papers, 1963-1973 AIS.1974.03
titlestmt.author: Bryce R. Henry.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-12-14 08:39:03 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Papers are mainly comprised of 1960s and early 1970s leftist publications on topics ranging from coal miners rights, civil rights movement, communism, Angela Davis, the draft, feminism, student unrest, syndicalism, the Vietnam War, unionism, etc. Additional types of material include correspondence, speeches, and photographs.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Harry F. Shaw, Jr., was born in Grafton, Taylor County, West Virginia, in 1946. He graduated from Grafton High School in 1964 and West Virginia University circa 1968; he majored in history. Shaw died in 2005.

While a student at West Virginia, Shaw organized the Student Action Against Poverty, served as chairman of the campus Students for a Democratic Society (SDS), and was an active member of the Mountaineer Freedom Party. Among his many non-campus activities, he was the Vietnam Summer Field Secretary for West Virginia in 1967. He worked for the American Friends Service Committee as a Vietnam Volunteer and helped to organize the Southern Student Organizing Committee. He was also active in the fight for improved coal mining conditions through the Black Lung Association and Miners for Democracy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Papers are arranged into seven series:
Series I. Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Personal Files
Series II. Southern Student Organizing Committee (SSOC)

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Frank A. Zabrosky circa 1978. It was entered into Archivists' Toolkit by Bryce Henry in September 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Papers were assembled by Shaw while he was an undergraduate at the University of West Virginia. It is comprised primarily of 1960s to early 1970s publications of a political and social activist nature including civil rights, draft resistance, labor movements, miners and mining conditions, race relations, and the Vietnam War. The regional focal point of the collection is in West Virginia, especially the University of West Virginia, but includes materials relating to Southern, national, and international organizations. Additional materials beyond publications include correspondence, memoranda, news clippings, pamphlets, and photographs.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harry F. Shaw, Jr. Papers, 1965-1973, AIS.1974.03, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Southern Student Organizing Committee (SSOC) was a 1960s student activist group in the Southern United States focused on social and political concerns, including opposition to the Vietnam War and the draft, workers' rights, and civil rights. Throughout its existence the group maintained close ties to the Students for a Democratic Society (SDS). The SSOC dissolved itself in 1969. This series is primarily comprised of publication reprints from other organizations. It also includes SSOC administrative items, correspondence, financial information, news releases, newsletters, pamphlets, and leaflets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Organizations series contains files on several leftwing organizations including the American Friends Service Committee, anti-Vietnam War groups, Black Panthers, the North American Communist Parties and other far left political parties and committees, socialist and union groups, and Students for a Democratic Society (SDS) amongst others. Materials in this series include conference agendas and materials, correspondence, financial documents, memoranda, minutes, newsletters, publications, rally notices, reports, and speeches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Subject Files series contains a variety of subjects including Appalachia and the South generally; black lung and coal mining; labor and unions; race relations; poverty; and Vietnam and the draft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
